headline: Banana Bran Muffins
description: This banana bran muffin recipe is easy to make with wheat bran cereal, crunchy walnuts, and lots of ripe bananas for a healthy breakfast or snack.
name: Banana Bran Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a muffin pan or line with paper liners.

Cream together butter and brown sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy. Add mashed bananas, eggs, milk, and vanilla; mix well. Stir in flour, bran, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; blend just until moistened. Stir in walnuts. Pour batter into the prepared muffin cups.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool muffins in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Fiancé and I loved them! I didn’t have any milk so substituted for equal part Greek yogurt (no sugar added, plain, 0%). Came our super fluffy and moist.
Love these good fiber as well!!

My husband loved these. I did substitute applesauce for the butter and used only 1 egg. I also used 1 c. all-purpose flour, 1/2 c. whole wheat flour and increased the wheat bran to 3/4 c. Added 1 tsp. pumpkin pie spice and 1/2 c. chocolate chips. I'm going to try the suggestion of adding pumpkin in place of the bananas.

Pretty solid recipe! I've made them twice, first time exactly as listed and second time with a few modifications. Second time I used whole wheat flour with the bran, added a basic autumnal spice mix (cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice), some chopped walnuts, and lastly a small sprinkle of mini cinnamon chips on top. Wanted to pump up the fiber content and flavor profile. Very yummy, and the added wheat flour only made them slightly denser. All the banana helps keep them moist. I think it would work very well with pumpkin instead of banana, too.

I didn't have some of the ingrediencies in my larder so I made some changes, still the most fabulous muffins I've ever had. here are the changes, butter milk instead of milk, Quaker Oats granola instead of bran, Pecans instead of walnuts.

Very good recipe. I made it a couple times. First time I didn't have vanilla, so I supplemented with almond extract, which was good. Second time, I followed recipe as is, but added 1/2 tsp of cinnamon. Delicious!

I used the basic recipe but made a few modifications. I added two additional tablespoons of butter; 1/4 c peanut butter protein, and 1.5 tablespoons of cocoa. They were amazing. I will definitely keep this recipe.
Next time I am going to substitute monk fruit sweetener for some of the brown sugar.
Delicious! Adding this to my favorites for use when bananas go overripe. Adding 1/2 c dried cranberries next time.
Wonderful recipe, I replaced the walnuts with chocolate chips because of a allergy to tree nuts.

This is a staple in my house. I did modify the flour ratios to minimize the all-purpose flour: 3/4 c. all-purpose flour, 3/4 c. coconut flour, 3/4 c. Wheat bran. Tastes great and makes my digestive system happy!
I used apple sauce instead of the butter and it came out so soft and delicious

Very good and forgiving recipe, just not much rise on the muffins. I used a little more wheat bran because I ran out of all-purpose flour, and I melted my butter so i could mix everything in one bowl instead of taking out my mixer to cream the butter and sugar. Worked well! I also added in a half cup of raisins instead of walnuts, so we still got the boost of fiber. I would definitely make these again!
I did use 1/2 butter , 1/2 coconut oil , and macadamia milk instead of regular milk, and added a handful of chocolate chips , and a handful of shredded coconut. They turned out awesome !!

These are amazing ! I changed out the wheat bran for oat bran since that's what I had on hand and use wheat flour and they turned out fabulous. Next time I make them I'm going to try it with a sugar substitute so my diabetic son can enjoy them too.
Oct 27, 2020 Used 1 1/4 cups flour, 1/4 cup cocoa powder, 2/3 cups chocolate chips. Will making again. 9/10
Super tasty. Make them a touch more healthier by switching half the flour to whole wheat and reduce the sugar to half the amount.
I’ve made them many times with this recipe. They turn out delicious every time.
We’re not big on nuts in my house. I use raisins instead. It’s a good recipe for using up those ripe bananas.
Great recipe, I cut down butter and sugar but increased banana and added zest of one orange. Also changed it to one cup bran and one cup flour. They turned out to be delicious!

Great base recipe. I used a stand mixer to mix everything really well before adding dry ingredients - no need to pre-mash bananas. Subbed out whole wheat flour, added 2 TBS flax, 1/4 c. nutritional yeast, 1TBS maca, ground cardamom (a few sprinkles), forgot the walnuts, and increased milk to 1/2 c because of added dry ingredients. Baked as mini muffins for a quick healthy snack. A+
Good basic recipe .. nothing to write home about but could become a staple in our home
Simple and tasty
This recipe is perfect just the way it is. You can also sub whole wheat flour and it's great too.
I left these in the oven for the 25 minutes on 375 and they came out perfectly!
I followed the recipe except I used blueberries (because I had some that needed to be used) instead of walnuts. Turned out great.
They have a good texture and taste. However, they are not sweet enough. I would add another 1/4 cup sugar to make them perfect.
I used KOHK1730 comments, and put in mini muffin tins. Everyone loved it.

This is the best banana bean recipe I've tried. I made it and added an individual serving size cup of unsweetened applesauce because I only had 2 bananas and substituted bran with K Raisin Bran and it was delicious!
No changes for me ! Very delicious and moist ..
I used raisin bran for bran
I doubled my batch and was 1 banana short, so I added 1/2 cup of cranberry sauce, and used oil instead of butter. They are lovely and moist, taste Great
Moist and delicious just like they should be. The kids loved them. Of course the half cup of chocolate chips I added didn't hurt.
Great recipe
I made these, only substituting solid coconut oil for the butter. They turned out well, flavourful and moist. Would definitely use the recipe again.

Really enjoy these muffins. Very moist! Not too sweet and not overpowering banana flavor. I did make the following changes: replaced 1/2 cup of the flour with whole wheat flour, and only had 2 bananas instead of 3 - but they were on the large side. Mashed up it was about 1 cup.

I used v1/4 cup vanilla greek yogurt with a splash of milk. Muffins had to bake longer than indicated (I made them in a six-muffin pan). They came out amazing. Slightly crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. Saving this recipe for sure.

Only my second attempt at baking from scratch. I followed almost exactly except I used heavy cream instead of milk and added strawberry chunks. I just wish they were a touch sweeter....like honey or molasses. There's always next time.

Five stars, but I did add chocolate chips because my brother requested them specifically! Also, I realized halfway through that I was out of baking soda, so I just used another tablespoon of baking powder and omitted the salt. I was surprised they turned out!
This recipe is a keeper. I replaced wheat flour with almond meal, and both bran and almond meal made them 1 cup each. Love these muffins; my 5yo asks for these all the time

Unbelievably moist! I followed a couple changes by the reviewers. Applesauce instead of butter and put some oat Bran. Crazy moist and tasty. Thank you.
ADDED after I made these....Help me please, why do these give us heartburn EVERY TIME we eat them?! So disappointing because they are soooo good! And I have a lot of bananas waiting to get into some muffins. :(

I made these for my toddler, therefore I cut the sugar in half but used brown sugar to maintain flavour. Recipe easily doubles. For a double-batch, I added 1/2 tsp nutmeg and 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon, plus about 1 cup cranberries. Replaced butter with 1/2 non-hydrogenated margarine and 1/2 applesauce. A total MOIST and DELISH end result!!!
used 1 stick of butter and yogurt instead.
i forgot eggs was still moist and insted of nuts i put in choc chips

Love this recipe - very versatile - Just made another batch using 1 mashed banana (all I had on hand) and 2/3 cup applesauce and added a couple of cups of blueberries. Delicious and I like that it doesn't use oil - 1/2 cup butter for 12 muffins.
fantastic! followed the recipe and they turned out great :)

This is a great base recipe. Initially made as written and very good, but I now use this as a base for wet/dry ingredients and have made it much more healthy. I sub applesauce for the oil/butter, sub ground oatmeal for the flour, and ground flax seed for the bran. I also use a bit less than 1/4 cup honey in place of the sugar. I double the recipe and freeze the muffins individually for a quick breakfast.

The muffins were nicely moist, the flavor was mild. I've made this twice. The second time though, I omitted the bananas and used 1 cup pumpkin purée and 1 tablespoon pumpkin pie spice. That turned out good, too.

These were awesome!
My son has a nut allergy so I swapped the walnuts for an equal amount of chocolate chips. Otherwise, I followed the recipe. I used my food processor to mix it all up, and a standard size ice cream scoop to measure it into my muffin pans. My son ate two before they had even cooled properly and his friend went home with four, but got home with only two hahahahaaa 
Lovely recipe and easy too. Plus the house smells gorgeous

I made these for my toddler. I substituted the walnuts for raisins to make them kid friendly and they turned out awesome! I also did as many others did and used applesauce in place of some of the butter. I will be making these again.

Very good! Nice, light texture. I used oat bran instead of wheat bran as that's what I had on hand, half while wheat flour & half white flour, and added chocolate chips instead of walnuts (kids aren't allowed to take nuts to school).
Made as per original recipe and it turned out delicious - moist and sweet. Will definitely make again.

fantastic, used entirely applesauce instead of oil/butter and flax seed and wheat germ (what I had) instead of the wheat bran. Cut back on brown sugar a bit. Love these also with whole wheat flour or white whole wheat flour. Very filling and healthy. Baked convection 360 for 18 min and were perfect. Have also added choc chips or cinnamon chips for a little treat. SO GOOD.
Excellent! Great tasting and great texture.

The recipe written as is, is very good. I made a few changes to suit us to make it even better. I used more bran and less flour and used half the sugar since the ripe bananas are quite sweet. I sometimes sub the nuts for dates or chocolate chips. Great as written though and have made many dozen of these.

Have made these muffins many times. Instead of all purpose flour, I use whole wheat flour. I also find the batter a little thick so I add a little extra water or milk to moisten the muffins. Otherwise, yummy muffins my whole family enjoys.
Best bran muffins. I'm did make the change of adding 1/4 cup apple sauce in place of butter
This is a great recipe! I loved the bran. I decreased the butter to a quarter cup and added a half of a cup of cinnamon applesauce. I also added a handful of raisins.
I can't eat wheat so I made these for my son and he loved them. I made them as the recipe called for, no modifications.
So moist and delicious. Less sugar than other recipes I have made and yet all the taste!
Very good - made as written with exception of Pepitas instead of walnuts. Going to make a second batch right way.
delicious. Will make again!!

I had to make some substitutions based on what I had, so I used honey instead of brown sugar and wheat flour instead of all purpose flour. In my oven, 20 minutes was perfect. The end muffin is slightly sweet and moist. A very good recipe.

I should of read other reviews....I used the 1/2 cup of butter and it was drenched in oil after it baked. I had to soak up excess oil from the muffins. Next time, I'll reduce the butter to half. It tasted really good, tho.
Delicious! Our new favorite banana muffins.

Great beginning made half recipe daily.Add1/4 cup dried dates, replaced flour w/ 1/4 rye,1/4wheat pastry flour,1/4 wheat germ or oats . On half recipe use 1 tbls. coconut oil and 11/2 tbls brown sugar. low fat low sugar.1/4 cup unsweetened apple sauce . still I love it !!

Very good, moist and great flavor. I hate giving a rating after having modified it, but the only thing I added was 1 tsp of cinnamon because I'm a cinnamon nut. I did not put nuts in as my family doesn't like them. I will definitely be making again.

If you are looking for classic banana bran muffin recipe, this is not it. The recipe does not call for molasses which makes me wonder where the attached picture of the muffins came from. Also since the amount of bran is so small they taste more like a muffins only made from flour - very dough-ie
Awesome. Just what I was looking for. Hubby loved 'em, too.
My family loves these muffins. This time instead of bananas, I used one large Apple diced and 1/2 unsweetened applesauce.
Great recipe. Added frozen blueberries instead of nuts. Recipe also works well with margarine.
Very happy with this recipe just the way it is, except, I didn't have bran so I used bran cereal. Even better.
Love love love this!

Very yummy muffin and will make again... I added a sprinkle of shredded coconut to each muffin before baking.
Next time I may add raspberries. Thanks for the recipe! Good kids snack for school.
Delicious, very buttery, sweet and moist. I loved them. I didn't have wheat bran and so used oat bran instead. My bananas were also fairly large so that may have helped them be moist and sweet.
Great. I added 1/3 C ground flax and chocolate chips instead of walnuts. Carob chips are also a healthier option.
These are amazing and great to eat while hot!!!! I definitely will be making more!!!
These are amazing! I needed to substitute to make dairy free- Coconut oil and almond milk and just added chia seeds. Love them!
Perfect! We used whole wheat flour and substituted a banana with 1/2 c applesauce.
Turned out really good. I used pecans instead of walnuts and oat bran instead of wheat bran. 20 mins was perfect in my oven at 375.

This recipe was delicious but I made a double batch and replace had of the butter for peanut butter add a few dark chocolate chips and flax seeds the family couldn't wait till they came out of the oven. YUMMY

This is a wonderful and easy recipe. I always make a new recipe exactly as the recipe says to, then if I want to tweek it I know where.My second batch I only changed the sweetner, but I did add a couple things. Butter? Of course, I'm not going to eat the whole batch. Instead of brown sugar (I don't know why folks think it's better for you, it's just white sugar with molasses added to it) I used organic sprouted barley malt syrup at 1/3 C. I soaked the bran in the milk while I prepared the batter, and, I added a cup of thawed cranberries that I gave a couple pulses in the processor and sprinkled a tablespoon of flour and a teaspoon of sugar on them before adding to batter. The flour keeps them suspended in the batter. I love the tart berries with the bananas and they came out just as wonderful as the original recipe. I normally use a scale for baking so I weighed the cup of cranberries I wanted in case anybody wants to add them.
Cranberries can be any size but weight is weight, chopped, whole, big or small. They weighed 5 oz.
Oh, to compensate for the extra moisture I used I simply used bread flour in stead. A cup of bread flour weighs a 1/4 oz more than all purpose. I made these in the giant 6 to a pan muffin pan.

I too tweaked this recipe to my taste. I use all wholewheat flour with 1/4 C ground flax seed. 4 bananas and omit the milk. They always turn out so moist with great banana flavor!Good guilt-free recipe.

I gave this a 4 because I made some variations. Very moist, great texture and very tasty muffins. I doubled this recipe and added 1/2c. flax seed meal, 1/4c. Chia seeds (grounded up) 2 tsp. all spice and 1 tsp. cinnamon. I also soaked the bran in the milk and added an extra 1/4c. milk (for added moisture because I added the extra flax and chia) I also did 2c. whole wheat flour and 1c. All purpose flour. (I usually take 1/2 butter and replace it with applesauce but didn't have any this time.) I didn't add the nuts as I wanted to send these to school for the kids lunches. Made 3/4 of the recipe plain and added Chocolate chips to the last portion. These Were Great. Will be keeping this recipe.

My 1 & 2 year olds love these. I follow the recipe other than replacing half of the butter with apple sauce and half of the white flour for whole wheat flour. I also used oat bran because that is what I had. Thanks for sharing!
Wow, really good. The bran and banana flavors are balanced nicely. Threw in some mini chocolate chips to tempt my picky eaters and the first batch was gone in less than two days.
It was very good, definitely a keeper recipe. Thanks for sharing!!

Love these! Sometimes I add cinnamon or semi-sweet chocolate chips, there are lots of variations you could implement! I also use half whole wheat flour and pecans over walnuts, just as a personal preference. They're such a great, wholesome snack on the go!
Pretty good. Made with applesauce instead of oil and oat bran instead of wheat. Next time I will add some berries to liven it up but as is a tasty, healthy breakfast or snack

I usually like to follow recipes, but I had extra stuff on hand, so I added craisins, cinnamon and nutmeg. I'll let you know how the alterations turn out! UPDATE: They turned out great. We both loved them!

OMG. These muffins are delicious. These are the only substitutions I made to make them healthier: substituded 1/4 cup coconut oil and 1/4 cup applesauce for the butter, decrease the flour to 1 cup and added in 1/2 cup oat bran, used 1/4 cup brown sugar and 2 tablespoons truvia baking sugar, and added a couple chocolate chips for good measure. HOLY MOLY. They are dense, moist, delicious and incredibly healthy!!!! And the batter made enough for about 16 muffins. I'll be making these as often as I have a sweet tooth (every single day). Thank you for the excellent recipe!

Good basic muffin recipe. I made a few changes to incorporate flax seeds and whole wheat flour. I replaced the eggs with ground flax seeds (1 tbsp flax seed meal + 3 tbsp water replaces 1 egg). I used 1 cup of wheat bran and 1/2 cup of each whole wheat and all purpose flour. The muffins came out moist and more healthy.

Very delicious. I took advice from other reviewers and reduced the butter to 4 tablespoons of unsalted, 1/4 cup of brown sugar,1/4 cup of molasses, 1/4 cup of applesauce, 2 tablespoons of wheat germ, 1 teaspoon nutmeg,2 teaspoons of cinnamon and increased the wheat bran to 1 cup. This may have more added ingredients than you may like, however these muffins are very moist and tasty.
These were pretty good very moist mine turned out a bit dense not as fluffy as i would of liked but still yummy!! i subbed apple sauce for the butter easy and pretty healthy!

Light, fluffy muffins. Even my teenager liked them. I doubled the bran (used bran buds cereal) and reduced the flour. Also used 1/4 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup molasses. Used raisins instead of walnuts. Yay! Super yummy!

Terrific! I have been looking for a decent, healthy banana bread recipe for ages! I used a whole wheat self rising flour (pancake flour actually) to reduce the number of ingredients I had to fool with (self rising allows you to skip the soda, powder, and salt). Otherwise followed recipe exactly. But next time I will try applesauce instead of butter - probably a 'heavy' 1/2cup to ensure moist muffins.

it was a very good recipe. i added an extra banana, but used less butter, flour and sugar. i substituted with a small Organic Applesauce (250 g, i think). and i used more Bran and Oatmeal to replace the flour so it was still a total of 2 cups. Very moist and tasty. and a bit healthier.

Love this recipe use it all the time and we're using it for a bake sale right now
signing off this is B & D S
Super yummy, moist and delicious even with a couple of healthy changes - I used applesauce instead of butter, also used half whole wheat flour. Highly recommend!
Very good! I added 1 tsp banana extract, I used 1/2 AP flour and 1/2 WW flour and 1/2 cup craisins. I also added 1 Tbsp lemon juice. Delicious, not too sweet, nice and moist. Thanks this is a keeper!
